ENTRY.refkeywords: weight weights weighted mkinstmap spectrumfile spectrum instrument exposure map image instmap expmap
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: make_instmap_weights - produces a weighted spectrum file usable with mkinstmap in order to create a weighted exposure map.

DESC.PARA: This tool creates a two-column ASCII file; the first column specifies the energy in keV (E_i) and the second column specifies a spectral weighting (W_i); from any Sherpa model. The spectral weight column should sum to 1. The spectral file is then used to compute the weighted instrument map as a linear combination of monochromatic maps at energies E_i with weights W_i for several energy-weight pairs. To learn more about spectral weightings and their affect on instrument maps, look at the "Calculating Spectral Weights for mkinstmap" analysis thread.

SYNTAX.LINE: unix% make_instmap_weights weights.txt "xsphabs.abs1*powlaw1d.p1" paramvals="abs1.nh=2.2;p1.gamma=1.6" emin=0.5 emax=10.0 ewidth=0.25

DESC.PARA: Create a spectral weights table, weights.txt, using an absorbed power-law with spectral index of 1.6 and neutral hydrogen column density of 2.2E+22 cm**-2 between 0.5-10.0 keV, with 0.25 keV energy bins. Note that parameter values must be separated by a semi-colon and that the paramvals name had to be given on the command line since its value containined the "=" character.
The output file (weights.txt) can be used as the value for the spectrumfile parameter of mkinstmap.

Create a spectral weights table using a XSpec redshifted, absorbed APEC plasma model. The redshift of the plasma model is linked to the photoelectric absorption redshift parameter and the plasma temperature is set to 6.4 keV. The XSpec solar abundance, used in plasma models, is set to Wilms, Allen & McCray (2000, ApJ 542, 914) and the photoelectric cross-section is set to Verner et al. (1996, ApJ 465, 487).

PARAM.name: outfile
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: The name of the spectral weights file to create.

DESC.PARA: The weights file created listing the energy bin center in keV in the first column and normalized weighting in the second column.

PARAM.name: model
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Sherpa model used to derive spectral weighting.

DESC.PARA: Any Sherpa model(s) may be used to determine a spectral weighting, as long as the model is entered as a string. For example: "xsphabs.abs1*powlaw1d.p1".

PARAM.name: paramvals
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Sherpa model parameters used to derive spectral weighting.

DESC.PARA: Model parameters listed as a string, with each parameter seperated by a semi-colon. For example: "abs1.nh=1.3;p1.gamma=1.7".

PARAM.name: emin
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Lower bound of model energy range in keV.

PARAM.name: emax
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Upper bound of model energy range in keV.

PARAM.name: ewidth
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Width of each energy bin in keV.

DESC.PARA: Sets the elemental abundance table used in XSpec plasma-code models.
Set the photoelectric cross-section used in XSpec absorption models.

PARAM.name: verbose
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Verbose can be from 0 to 5, generating different amounts of output.

PARAM.name: clobber
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: If set to yes, existing output files will be overwritten.
